abstract: A Senate panel will look at Google’s proposed acquisition of DoubleClick on Thursday. After a lot of discussion about privacy, the consensus seems to be that the deal will be approved this fall.
snippet: A Senate panel will look at Google’s proposed acquisition of DoubleClick on Thursday. After a lot of discussion about privacy, the consensus seems to be that the deal will be approved this fall.
lead_paragraph: Google’s $3.1 billion deal in April to buy DoubleClick set off a wave of advertising acquisitions by Microsoft, Yahoo, AOL and others. All of those deals have been completed, but Google is still waiting while regulators in Washington and Europe consider the antitrust and privacy implications of its proposed combination.

headline.main: Google’s Washington Hazing for Its DoubleClick Deal
